bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, July 23, 1897

div1.p: Lazear writes that he plans to return to Baltimore at the end of August.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, July 23, 1897
div1.p:
Your letter
came yesterday. I am
sorry it is so hot
at Hatley. I should
think Miss May would
let you off from your
bargain if the place
is so full.

We shall return
to Baltimore the last
of August and may
perhaps spend a few
weeks at some
farmhouse in the
mountains. It is cold
here but it is
hardly country.

It might be nice
to spend two or three
weeks in the Kalskills.
Do you know of any
cheap boarding-house
there? It would be
directly on our way
home.

Mrs. Houston and Nellie arrived
on Sunday. They stood the
trip well and enjoy it here
very much. I don't believe
they will come to see us
until nearly Spring. Mrs Houston
asked all about you and
wished you could be here.

I don't believe I told you that
I had a letter from Joe Seth
saying that Dr. Diffendaerfer had
been killed by the Trolley car at
the Hillenberger gate.
